result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Erik McFarland

4:32 PM Defendant Darren Vaughn Fengier in court.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Darren Vaughn Fengier.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

4:33 p.m.  Officer M Fletcher is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Dodge.
4:35 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Dodge would ask that the record reflect that the witness identified the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
The record so reflects the identification.
4:36 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty McFarland.
ADA Dodge has no redirect.
4:38 p.m.  Witness is excused.
ADA Dodge has no further witnesses.
Atty McFarland does not have any witnesses.
Neither party has any final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

ADA Dodge states that an amended information had been filed.
Atty McFarland wishes to have the arraignment on a separate date.

BY THE COURT: 
Bond is continued
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:07 PM Defendant Darren Vaughn Fengier not in court.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Darren Vaughn Fengier.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant fails to appear.
ADA Dodge would request a warrant with a $750 cash alternative.
Atty McFarland has no information for the court.

BY THE COURT: 
Warrant with a $750 cash alternative

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Darren Vaughn Fengier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Taylor Soule appears in court. 

Facts as previously stated for Pandora Weir.
